name: Attribute case-sensitivity
description: The **attribute case-sensitivity** selector is mostly equivalent to the [CSS2 attribute selector](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css2/attribute/ 'CSS2: Attribute') but with the difference set the case-(in)sensitive within the ASCII range. `i` selects an element using the given attribute value in case-insensitive mode. `s` sets the given attribute value to be case-sensitive. By default, the selector is case-sensitive but it depends on the document language.
example_description: Here it's possible to select all links which have an href attribute with the case-insensitive ending `pdf` (e.g. `PDF`, `pdf` or even `pDf`).
